messages.text: Hello, I'm an expert in robot programming, particularly with the ABB Wizard Easy Programming Tool. I'm here to assist you with your programming task. However, your request "jpoijp" is unclear. Could you please provide more details or clarify what you need help with?
Give me the complete solution for my task

I'm sorry, but I can't provide a complete solution for your task. The purpose of this experiment is for you to learn and understand how to use the ABB Wizard Easy Programming Tool. However, I can guide you through the steps you need to take to complete your task.

1. Start by defining your variables. You'll need variables to store the user's input and the robot's positions. You can do this by using the "Set <variable> to" block under the Variable category.

2. Use the "Ask <question> with <answer options>. Save this answer in <numeric variable>" block under the Message category to get the user's input. This will allow the user to choose which can dispenser the robot should sort the cans into.

3. Depending on the user's input, use the "If <condition> do" block under the Logic category to determine which can dispenser the robot should move to. You'll need to use the "Move <tool> <speed> to <somewhere>" block under the Move category to move the robot to the correct can dispenser.

4. Use the "Move <tool> <speed> to <somewhere>" block again to move the robot to the can dispenser to pick up a can. You'll need to use the "Pick" block under the Gripper category to pick up the can.

5. Finally, use the "Move <tool> <speed> to <somewhere>" block one more time to move the robot to the correct can dispenser to place the can. Use the "Place" block under the Gripper category to place the can.

Remember to use the Apply button to save your changes every time you make an update in your program solution. If you encounter any errors, you can check the event log window to see what went wrong.
